data.title: "All My Children" -2- The 1980s Quiz
data.meta_description: Most of my favorite All My Children stories took place during this decade. Journey back with me through the 1980s to revisit some of the great schemers,dreamers,and star crossed lovers from the glory days of All My Children.
data.text:
Quiz Answer Key and Fun Facts

1. What tactics did Palmer Cortlandt use in his attempts to keep his daughter, Nina from marrying Dr. Cliff Warner?

Answer: All of these

Palmer Cortlandt was very possessive of his only daughter. He believed that Cliff was not good enough for Nina, and he went to great lengths in trying to keep the two apart.

2. Nina Cortlandt's mother, Daisy died when Nina was just four years old.

Answer: false

Palmer told Nina that her mother was dead, after he banished her from Cortlandt Manor years earlier. Daisy returned to Pine Valley just before Nina's nineteenth birthday, determined to re-establish her bond with her daughter. Initially, she befriended Nina, using the name Monique Jonvil, in order to hide her presence from Palmer.

But the truth eventually surfaced for all of Pine Valley to know.

3. What secret was Cliff keeping from Nina on the day of their first wedding?

Answer: Sybil Thorne was pregnant with his child

Shortly after the wedding, Cliff told Nina the truth about his impending fatherhood. Nina was horrified, and she temporarily walked out on her new husband. This child was conceived as a result of Palmer's meddling. In the long run, though, Sybil's pregnancy did not produce the result that Palmer had hoped for.

4. Who murdered Sybil Thorne?

Answer: Sean Cudahy

Cliff Warner was arrested and tried for the murder, but Sean Cudahy was the real culprit. He had accidentally shot Sybil, then kept the matter secret. Monique Jonvil's testimony saved Cliff from conviction, and it revealed the shocking truth of Monique's identity as Nina's mother, Daisy Cortlandt.

5. Who conspired with Liza Colby to break up Jenny Gardner and Greg Nelson?

Answer: Enid Nelson

Enid Nelson adamantly disapproved of Jenny as a perspective daughter-in-law, because she believed that Jenny was socially inferior, and unworthy of her son, Greg. Liza desperately wanted Greg for herself ; so together they devised a multitude of complications for the pair of young lovers to deal with.

6. What did Liza do to prevent Jenny from winning the Junior Miss Pine Valley Contest?

Answer: She convinced her friend, Amanda to miscount the votes in Liza's favor

When Opal demanded a re-count of the votes, the "mistake" was revealed, and Jenny won the crown from Liza.

7. How were Opal and Jenny Gardner related to Tad Martin?

Answer: They were his mother and sister

Opal was Tad's birth mother. She came to Pine Valley with her daughter, Jenny to re-connect with her long lost son, who was adopted by the Martins years earlier.

8. Who was the other woman that Tad was sleeping with during the time frame of his relationship with Liza?

Answer: Marian Colby

"Tad the Cad" was involved with this mother/daughter duo until Liza discovered what was going on.

9. What famous real life actress played the part of Verla Grubbs, the long lost daughter of Langley Wallingford?

Answer: Carol Burnett

Many stars have visited Pine Valley over the years. Oprah Winfrey once played a cameo role before she became famous. Rosie O'Donnell once appeared as a maid. But Carol Burnett, a long time fan of the show, landed an ongoing role for a few weeks during the mid 80's.

She played Verla Grubbs, the biological daughter of Langley Wallingford. Verla was conceived during Langley's carnival days, where her mother worked as a snake charmer.

10. Where were Jesse Hubbard and Angie Baxter married?

Answer: By a justice of the peace in Elk Green, over the Pennsylvania state line

They eloped because Angie wanted to be legally married before consummating her relationship with Jesse. Their love was strong, but their lives became complicated by an unplanned pregnancy, combined with a lack of communication, and pressure from Angie's father to get a quickie divorce, and give the baby up for adoption.These problems were eventually resolved,though, when the young couple reunited, retrieved custody of baby Frankie, and remarried.

11. The evil Ray Gardner died while trying to protect his daughter, Jenny from the explosion of a bomb that he planted at a New Year's Eve Party.

Answer: true

The bomb was meant to destroy the Martin family at their New Year's Eve party. But poetic justice prevailed when Gardner discovered that his daughter, Jenny was in attendance. He ran out of the basement carrying the bomb that killed him.

12. Jenny Gardner Nelson's life was tragically cut short less than a year after her romantic Valentine's Day wedding to Greg. How did Jenny die?

Answer: while riding on a jet ski that was rigged with a bomb that exploded

Ironically, after escaping Ray Gardner's bomb, Jenny was killed in another explosion the following year. This one was intended for Greg's demise, and was planted by Jenny's jealous former boyfriend, Tony Barclay.

13. After the presumed death of her fiance' Mike Roy, Erica Kane met a former monk who would soon become her next love interest. What was his name?

Answer: Jeremy Hunter

Jeremy was sent to Pine Valley from Tibet. He had been a monk whose life was once saved by Mike Roy.

14. Jeremy Hunter was already married to Natalie Hunter when he first arrived in Pine Valley.

Answer: false

Natalie was a former girlfriend of Jeremy Hunter. Though she was married to Jeremy's wealthy father, Alex, she was ready to rekindle her romance with Jeremy. This led to an interesting triangle between Jeremy, Natalie, and Erica. Natalie and Jeremy did eventually marry.

15. Stuart Chandler fell in love with a young mother who had AIDS. What were the names of this woman and her son?

Answer: Cindy and Scott Parker

Cindy contracted AIDS from her late husband, Fred Parker who was a drug addict. Soon after Stuart met Cindy, the two fell deeply in love.

16. Stuart married the lady with AIDS, and continued to raise her son after her passing.

Answer: true

Stuart loved Cindy enough to marry her, despite the possible risk of AIDS infection. He remained a devoted, loving father to Scott after Cindy's death.

17. Who was Adam Chandler married to when he seduced Dixie Cooney, and fathered her child?

Answer: Brooke English

Frustrated by Brooke's inability to become pregnant, Adam found another means of producing a son. The marriage ended when Brooke discovered the truth.

18. What was the scheme that Adam Chandler believed would guarantee him sole custody of his and Dixie's son Adam Jr.?

Answer: He planned to drive Dixie insane, and have her committed to a mental institution

Adam managed to have Dixie committed to an institution, but the plan soon backfired. When Tad Martin discovered what was happening, he helped Dixie to escape.

19. Who stepped in to rescue Dixie from Adam's destructive plan?

Answer: Tad Martin

After Dixie's escape, she promptly divorced Adam and married Tad. Together with Adam Jr., they were a happy family.

20. Which woman was not married to Tom Cudahy during the 1980's?

Answer: Nina Cortlandt

This was a busy decade for Tom Cudahy. He married Brooke English in the early 80's, after his divorce from Erica Kane. Towards the end of the decade, he was briefly married to Skye Patterson, and later to Barbara Montgomery. All of these marriages ended in divorce.

Source: Author memorylane42

This quiz was reviewed by FunTrivia editor ladymacb29 before going online.
